subs.text: An experiment: discovered a jar of 32 year old (!) Chana Dahl lurking in the cupboard. Decided to see if it's possible to cook it. Overnight soak then on induction cooker. It is SLOWLY (very slowly) softening. What outcome do you predict? How many hours of cooking? [link]
subs.rawText:
An experiment: discovered a jar of 32 year old (!) Chana Dahl lurking in the cupboard. Decided to see if it's possible to cook it. Overnight soak then on induction cooker. It is SLOWLY (very slowly) softening.

What outcome do you predict? How many hours of cooking? https://t.co/IAkZP9nZHh

subs.text: Update after many hours of cooking, still not softe enough to be pleasant to eat. Tomorrow, unless something changes over night, these 32 year old lentils will be put on my compost pile.
subs.rawText: Update after many hours of cooking, still not softe enough to be pleasant to eat. Tomorrow, unless something changes over night, these 32 year old lentils will be put on my compost pile.

subs.text:
UPDATE: after HOURS of cooking, the Dahlhumbled me. I ate a few spoonfuls, out of a sense of duty. Taste was meh and they never softened up enough to have pleasant mouth feel. They are now on the compost pile where the bacteria and bugs and worms will have a feast. 

Bon appetit.
subs.rawText:
UPDATE: after HOURS of cooking, the Dahlhumbled me. I ate a few spoonfuls, out of a sense of duty. Taste was meh and they never softened up enough to have pleasant mouth feel. They are now on the compost pile where the bacteria and bugs and worms will have a feast. 

Bon appetit.

subs.text: @MLovesDemocracy @ericgarland @Washerein17 I appreciate your point & I completely agree. But we are where we are. I am not a big Pence fan, and disagree totally with many of his views. But in the crunch, when it would have been MUCH easier to go along with TFG's demands, he stood by the constitution. He saved the day.
subs.rawText: @MLovesDemocracy @ericgarland @Washerein17 I appreciate your point & I completely agree. But we are where we are. I am not a big Pence fan, and disagree totally with many of his views. But in the crunch, when it would have been MUCH easier to go along with TFG's demands, he stood by the constitution. He saved the day.

subs.text: @MLovesDemocracy @ericgarland @Washerein17 But... his role in advising VP Pence to NOT go along with the coup was crucial. In the moment, he absolutely was a patriot. We came so very close to losing our democracy.
subs.rawText: @MLovesDemocracy @ericgarland @Washerein17 But... his role in advising VP Pence to NOT go along with the coup was crucial. In the moment, he absolutely was a patriot. We came so very close to losing our democracy.

subs.text:
1 of 2 
Why I can't abandon my Facebook seldom used Facebook account: FB Groups are useful for focused interests, e.g. milkweed (required by Monarch butterflies)  and customer support for various products. 

Also, FB Messenger is used as our family chat. It's fine.
subs.rawText:
1 of 2 
Why I can't abandon my Facebook seldom used Facebook account: FB Groups are useful for focused interests, e.g. milkweed (required by Monarch butterflies)  and customer support for various products. 

Also, FB Messenger is used as our family chat. It's fine.

subs.text:
2 of 2 
Why I can't abandon Facebook (even though I hate some of the stuff they've done).
Yesterday, out of the blue, a friend from my childhood (with his new wife) popped into a video FB Messenger chat. Not sure how he found me, but it was a delight to reconnect.

Thanks Zuck!
